question.body: Hemostasis requires normal amounts of clotting factors. The condition that results in excessive bleeding due to overconsumption of clotting factors is __________.

response.feedback: Correct. In DIC, clotting factors are consumed after a significant body insult, leaving the person at risk for excessive bleeding.
Incorrect. Hemophilia A (most common type of hemophilia) is a genetic deficiency in clotting factor VIII, which leads to excessive bleeding, not because the clotting factors have been overconsumed.

Incorrect. Hemophilia B (second most common type of hemophilia) is a genetic deficiency in clotting factor IX (also known as Christmas disease), which leads to excessive bleeding, not because the clotting factors have been overconsumed.

Incorrect. Factor VII deficiency is caused by a genetic deficiency in a clotting factor and/or vitamin K deficiency, which leads to excessive bleeding, not because the clotting factors have been overconsumed.
